Key Match Events: Ivan Schranz scored an early winning goal after just seven minutes.
Romelu Lukaku missed multiple chances and had two goals disallowed by VAR.
Jérémy Doku made a critical mistake in his own penalty area, leading to Slovakia's only goal.
Post-Match Reflections: Domenico Tedesco refused to blame VAR for the defeat.
Lukaku is Belgium's all-time leading goalscorer but struggled in the match.
The match showcased Belgium's reliance on individual brilliance rather than a cohesive team strategy.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game featured extensive use of VAR, impacting several key decisions.
Slovakia demonstrated strong organization and resilience against a star-studded Belgium team.
